title: Trump Bets on Diplomacy Without Diplomats
summary: President Trump’s most trusted envoys, Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner, are at the center of the Iran and Ukraine negotiations.

title: U.S. and Iran Make ‘Good Progress’ in Geneva Talks, Foreign Minister Says
summary: The Iranian minister, Abbas Araghchi, said both sides had agreed on a “set of guiding principles.” President Trump has called on Iran to make an immediate accord or face a possible U.S. attack.

title: Talks on Russia-Ukraine War Enter 2nd Day in Geneva
summary: The talks in Geneva, Switzerland, were expected to focus on Ukrainian-held territory in the east that Russia wants to control as the price of peace. Kyiv has said that demand is a nonstarter.

title: Mamdani Threatens 9.5% Property Tax Increase if Wealth Tax Is Not Passed
summary: Mayor Zohran Mamdani said his proposal to raise New York City property taxes was a “last resort” to close a budget gap.

title: Mamdani Ushers in a New Tradition: Ramadan in City Hall
summary: Zohran Mamdani, New York City’s first Muslim mayor, will observe Ramadan as he runs the nation’s largest city, blending his faith into his public life.

title: Colbert Slams Trump Administration After CBS Pulls Talarico Interview
summary: Stephen Colbert said he had to drop an interview with James Talarico from his Monday broadcast because of new F.C.C. guidance that targeted political interviews on late-night shows.

title: Jesse Jackson’s Death Arrives at a Crucial Moment for Black Political Power
summary: There are more Black senators than ever before, but a major Supreme Court ruling could reduce Black representation in the House.

title: How a Stray Quote of Jesse Jackson’s Led to a Rupture Between Black and Jewish Voters
summary: The candidate’s reference to New York as “Hymietown” helped tank his 1984 presidential campaign and eroded a longstanding alliance.

title: Jackson’s ‘Keep Hope Alive’ Speech in 1988 Was a Call for Social Justice and Unity
summary: Though he didn’t win the Democratic nomination for president in either year, Jesse Jackson’s moving speeches at the conventions called on the party to care more about the marginalized.

title: Jesse Jackson, Charismatic Champion of Civil Rights, Dies at 84
summary: An impassioned orator, he was a moral and political force, forming a “rainbow coalition” of poor and working-class people and seeking the presidency. His mission, he said, was “to transform the mind of America.”

title: Six of 16 Skiers Caught in California Avalanche Near Lake Tahoe Are Rescued
summary: Rescuers pulled six survivors from a remote California site where 16 backcountry skiers were caught in an avalanche, the authorities said. Ten others were still missing.

title: 4 Dead in Colorado Crash as Strong Winds Kick Up Wildfire Warnings
summary: High winds were fueling the risk of wildfires across the Southwest and the Plains, and an Oklahoma town faced a mandatory evacuation. Officials said the weather had caused a deadly pileup in Colorado.

title: The Sleepy Market for Japanese Government Bonds Is Now a ‘Battlefield’
summary: Trading of Japanese government bonds, long considered moribund, is roaring back to life as fears of the country’s debt have sent yields surging.

title: Trump Hails Japan’s First Batch of U.S. Investments
summary: The deals, totaling $36 billion, were the first step in a $550 billion investment pledge aimed at securing tariff relief and sustaining U.S. relations.

title: White House Shrugs Off Lutnick’s Epstein Ties
summary: Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick has acknowledged traveling to Jeffrey Epstein’s island and meeting him on another occasion.

title: A Road Trip from Kandahar to Kabul on Highway 1 in Afghanistan
summary: Life and business are back along a road once defined by war damage. But even with improved security, Afghans are desperate for jobs and development.

title: Daniel Radcliffe on Returning to Broadway in ‘Every Brilliant Thing’
summary: The Tony winner returns to the stage in “Every Brilliant Thing,” an interactive monologue with a message of hope “that might be vital for somebody to hear.”

title: Alberto Tomba Was an ’80s Icon. The Olympics Have Brought Him Back.
summary: Nicknamed “Tomba la Bomba,” the Italian skier was a global superstar before he drifted from the limelight. Decades later, the Winter Games have given him a new platform.

title: California Wealth Tax Opponents Intensify Efforts Before Bernie Sanders Visit
summary: The opponents’ latest moves include online ads tied to Gov. Gavin Newsom, a crypto-related push to raise money and competing ballot measures.

title: Potomac Sewage Spill Becomes Ecological Disaster and Political Fight
summary: A D.C. utility had been working for weeks to repair a collapsed sewer line when the president blamed Maryland’s governor for the contamination on Monday.

title: Height Surgery for Men Can Add Inches But Has Risks
summary: Limb-lengthening can add inches to a person’s stature. But its risks have made it controversial.

title: Boneless Wings Are Still Wings, Judge Rules
summary: A Chicago man filed a lawsuit in 2023 against Buffalo Wild Wings, arguing that it had engaged in false advertising of its boneless wings. A judge said the claim “has no meat on its bones.”

title: Netanyahu Plays Trump and American Jews for Fools — Again
summary: Netanyahu has gotten Trump to focus on Iran and ignore the destructive things Bibi is doing in Gaza, in the West Bank and inside Israel.

title: What the American Right Wants From Europe
summary: The tensions in Marco Rubio’s trans-Atlantic vision.

title: Manhattan Hospital Ends Medical Treatment for Transgender Youth
summary: NYU Langone Health cited the “current regulatory environment” in its decision to discontinue its gender medicine program for minors.

title: It’s Mardi Gras in New Orleans. This Year, the Party Might Be a Bit Greener.
summary: Carnival can generate more than 1,000 tons of trash every year. A coalition of nonprofit groups, city officials and scientists has a plan to clean it up.

title: Shia LaBeouf Charged With Battery in New Orleans
summary: The actor, known for his roles in “Transformers” and “Megalopolis,” was arrested early Tuesday after reportedly assaulting two people, the authorities said.

title: Peru Votes to Impeach President José Jerí
summary: Peru’s Congress voted to impeach President José Jerí, four months after he replaced Dina Boluarte, who had also been removed from the presidency.
